entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease Declaratory (Controlled Area) (Scotland) (No. 3) Amendment (No. 4) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Declaratory (Controlled Area) (Scotland) (No. 3) Order 2001 (“the Controlled Area Order”) within the permitted areas. It requires the written approval of the Divisional Veterinary Manager and notification to the Scottish Ministers to permit the use of the power of an inspector to prohibit entry by notice onto land or into agricultural buildings under the Controlled Area Order. Where such entry has been prohibited without such approval or notification, that prohibition shall cease to have effect.

entry.title: Feeding Stuffs (Sampling and Analysis) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Feeding Stuffs (Sampling and Analysis) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 and implement Commission Directive 2000/45/EC establishing Community methods of analysis for the determination of vitamin A, vitamin E and tryptophan in feedingstuffs (O.J. No. L174, 13.7.2000, p. 32).

title.div: The Education (Extension of Careers Education) (Wales) Regulations 2001 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Estyn Addysg Gyrfaoedd) (Cymru) 2001

div.p: These Regulations which apply to Wales make provision for extending the requirement to provide a programme of careers education to include pupils who are over compulsory school age and students aged between 16 and 19 attending institutions within the further education sector.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru, yn gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer estyn y gofyniad i ddarparu rhaglen addysg gyrfaoedd i gynnwys disgyblion sydd dros oedran ysgol gorfodol a myfyrwyr rhwng 16 a 19 oed sy'n mynychu sefydliadau o fewn y sector addysg bellach.

entry.title: The Artificial Insemination of Cattle (Emergency Licences) (Scotland) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: Regulation 3 of these Regulations empowers the Scottish Ministers to issue emergency licences during outbreaks of foot-and-mouth disease (as defined in regulation 2).

entry.title: The Financial Investigations (Northern Ireland) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order amends Part IV of the Proceeds of Crime (Northern Ireland) Order 1996 (NI 9) (“the 1996 Order”).

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Armorial Bearings) (Wales) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order authorises Crickhowell Town Council to bear and use the armorial bearings of the former Crickhowell Rural District Council and The Vale of Glamorgan County Borough Council to bear and use the armorial bearings of the former Vale of Glamorgan Borough Council.

entry.title: Code of Practice (Access to Workers during Recognition and Derecognition Ballots) (Appointed Day) Order (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation, on 17th June 2001, the Code of Practice on Access to Workers during Recognition and Derecognition Ballots, which is issued by the Department of Higher and Further Education, Training and Employment under Article 95(1) of the Industrial Relations (Northern Ireland) Order 1992.

entry.title: The Advisory Centre on WTO Law (Immunities and Privileges) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order confers the legal capacities of a body corporate on the Advisory Centre for WTO Law. This legal capacity is conferred in accordance with Article 10(1) of the Agreement establishing the Advisory Centre on WTO Law (Cm. 4721). The Order will enable Her Majesty’s Government to give effect to Article 10(1) of the Agreement, and will come into force on the date on which the Agreement enters into force in respect of the United Kingdom.

entry.title: Child Minding and Day Care (Registration and Annual Fees) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: This version of the Child Minding and Day Care (Registration and Annual Fees) Regulations 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Liberia (United Nations Sanctions) (Overseas Territories) (No. 2) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946, applies to each of the territories specified in Schedule 1. It imposes restrictions, pursuant to a decision of the Security Council of the United Nations in its resolution 1343 of 7th March 2001, on the import of rough diamonds from Liberia. The Order also makes a textual amendment to the Liberia (United Nations Sanctions) (Overseas Territories) Order 2001.

entry.title: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Commencement No. 7 (England) and Transitional, Transitory and Savings Provisions) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of the Care Standards Act 2000 (“the Act”) in relation to England only.

entry.title: The A508 (M1 Junction 15 To A45 Queen Eleanor Roundabout) (Trunking) Order 2001
entry.summary: This version of the The A508 (M1 Junction 15 To A45 Queen Eleanor Roundabout) (Trunking) Order 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-And-Mouth Disease) (No. 7) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation 4(3)(b)(ii) of the Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No. 7) Regulations 2001 which permit the export of fresh meat obtained from cutting plants under certain conditions. The amendment specifies an alternative health mark that must be used in respect of certain biungulates.

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-And-Mouth Disease) (No. 6) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation 4(3)(b)(ii) of the Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease)(No. 6) (Wales) Regulations 2001 which permit the export of fresh meat obtained from cutting plants under certain conditions. The amendment specifies an alternative health mark that must be used in respect of certain biungulates.

entry.title: The A45 (A508 Queen Eleanor Roundabout to the A14) (Trunking) Order 2001
entry.summary: This version of the The A45 (A508 Queen Eleanor Roundabout to the A14) (Trunking) Order 2001 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Social Security Contributions (Deferred Payments and Interest) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations apply, with modifications, the provisions of section 107 of the Finance Act 2001 (“section 107”) for the purposes of Class 1, Class 1A and Class 1B social security contributions.

entry.title: The Foot-and-Mouth Disease (Amendment) (Wales) (No.7) Order 2001
entry.summary: This Order replaces Parts III and IV of the Foot-and-Mouth Disease Order 1983 (“the 1983 Order”) (S.I. 1983/1950). It consolidates the changes made to these Parts by—

entry.title: The Health and Personal Social Services (Assessment of Resources) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations make further amendments to the Health and Personal Social Services (Assessment of Resources) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1993 (“the principal regulations”) which relate to the assessment by Health and Social Services Boards and HSS trusts of the resources of residents in accommodation arranged under Articles 15 and 36 of the Health and Personal Social Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1972.

entry.title: Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in Northern Ireland certain changes in the restrictions on imports and exports of certain animals and animal products in accordance with Commission Decision 2001/356/EC (O.J. No. L125, 4.5.2001, p. 40) concerning certain protection measures with regard to foot-and-mouth disease in the United Kingdom and repealing Commission Decision 2001/172/EC (O.J. No. L 94, 3.4.2001, p. 27). The principal change is to the conditions under which mince meat and meat preparations may be exported.

entry.title: The Social Security Contributions (Share Options) Regulations 2001
entry.summary: The Social Security Contributions (Share Options) Act 2001 (c. 20) (“ the Act”) contains provisions for the limitation of liability to pay social security contributions in respect of gains arising on the exercise, assignment or release of certain share options. In order for these provisions to be used, a notice must be given to the Inland Revenue within ninety-two days of the day on which the Act is passed (11th May 2001). Where such a notice is given, a special contribution is payable in respect of the gain, if any, which would have arisen had the share option been exercised, assigned or released on 7th November 2000.
